description: Provides the location and metadata of the media files corresponding to timerange segments of a Flow.
title: Flow Segment

object_id.description: The object store identifier for the media object.

ts_offset.description: The timestamp offset between the sample timestamps stored in the media file and the corresponding timestamp in the segment, ie. ts_offset = segment ts - media object ts. Assumed to be 0:0 if not set. Format as described by the [Timestamp](../schemas/timestamp#top) type, but cannot be negative

timerange.description: The timerange from the first sample in the segment to the last, with an inclusive start and inclusive or exclusive end, as described by the [TimeRange](../schemas/timerange#top) type. Note that where temporal re-ordering is used, this refers to the presentation timeline.

last_duration.description: The duration of the last sample in the segment (which may differ from that of the object). Defaults to 1/rate if a fixed media rate is set. Format as described by the [Timestamp](../schemas/timestamp#top) type, but cannot be negative

sample_offset.description: The start of the segment represented as a count of samples from the start of the object. Note that a sample is a video frame or audio sample. A (coded) audio frame has multiple audio samples

sample_count.description: The count of samples in the segment (which may be fewer than in the object). The count could be less than expected given the segment duration and rate if there are gaps. If not set, every sample from sample_offset onwards is used. Note that a sample is a video frame or audio sample. A (coded) audio frame has multiple audio samples

get_url.description: A URL to which a GET request can be made to directly retrieve the contents of the segment. This is required by the `http_object_store` media store type, which is the only one currently described. Clients should include credentials if the provide URL is on the same origin as the API endpoint

key_frame_count.description: The number of key frames in the segment. This should be set greater than zero when the segment contains key frames that serve as a stream access point
